label: Legal Record with Notation
description: Deed of property documenting sale of Horse Neck by Wyandanch (Wyandance), sachem of the Montaukett tribe, to Nathaniel Sylvester.
source: Sylvester Manor Archive; MSS 208; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

label: Research Writing with Notation
description: A list of documents regarding land purchases on Shelter Island by the Sylvester family and others. Contracts made with Native Americans on Shelter Island indicated
source: Sylvester Manor Archive; MSS 208; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
rights: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. label: Legal Record with Notation & Seal
description: This is a legal record of ownership of Shelter Island, with mention of original “Manhansucke” indigenous ownership and that the island was called “Ahaquatzunamocke” by them. This document is also emblematic of the Sylvester Manor’s relationship to the Barbados plantations, and the Sylvesters’ dependency on the slave trade.
source: Sylvester Manor Archive; MSS 208; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
rights: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University.
